Sentencas: Severe degradation of Ni-YSZ (yttria stabilized zirconia) electrodes of solid oxide cells (SOCs) due to Ni migration is well known, but the literature contains apparent contradictions.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: The mechanisms are still under debate.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: Fine structured Ni-YSZ composite electrodes often degrade at operation temperature (700-950 degrees C), because Ni particles lose electrical contact with each other as larger Ni-particles grow on the expense of smaller ones.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: Another type of Ni migration, which may be very damaging, is the relocation of Ni in the most active part of the Ni-YSZ cermet electrode next to the dense YSZ electrolyte.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: Emphasis is put on the migration of Ni away from the YSZ electrolyte in solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs).
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: This is seen as an important obstacle to the commercialization of SOC systems.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: Apart from temperature, degradation of Ni-YSZ electrodes in SOCs is related to Ni-YSZ electrode overpotential and the local redox potential of the gas mixture inside the porous Ni-YSZ electrode.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: A unifying Ni migration mechanism is proposed, and methods of alleviating the electrode degradation are discussed.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: The hypothesis is that Ni migrates via surface diffusion of Ni(OH)(x) species below ca.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis

Sentencas: 800 degrees C and via Ni(OH)(x) species in gas phase above ca.
Titulo: Ni migration in solid oxide cell electrodes: Review and revised hypothesis
